definitions.definition: a thing said or done that serves as a signal to an actor or other performer to enter or to begin their speech or performance.
examples: signal, sign, indication, prompt, reminder; Morenod, word, gesture "the blinking blue light is my cue to lower the volume"Morenod, word, gesture the blinking blue light is my cue to lower the volume
any conversational lull was my cue for asking a question

definitions.definition: a piece of information or circumstance that aids the memory in retrieving details not recalled spontaneously.
a feature of something perceived that is used in the brain's interpretation of the perception.
examples: expectancy is communicated both by auditory and visual cues

definitions.definition: a hint or indication about how to behave in particular circumstances.
examples: my teacher joked about such attitudes and I followed her cue

definitions.definition: a facility for playing through an audio or video recording very rapidly until a desired starting point is reached.
give a cue to or for.
examples: curious pedestrians are cued by the arrival of stretch limousines

definitions.definition: act as a prompt or reminder.
examples: have a list of needs and questions on paper to cue you

definitions.definition: set a piece of audio or video equipment in readiness to play (a particular part of the recorded material).
examples: features make it easier to cue up a tape for editing

definitions.definition: a long, straight, tapering wooden rod for striking the ball in pool, billiards, snooker, etc.
use a cue to strike a ball in pool, billiards, snooker, etc.
